column2: Sueann, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Just too many side effects after one month. Stopped taking it and am seeing my doctor in the am. Would not suggest this drug to anyone.

column2: mary, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this drug 2 months ago to help with flareup from Lupus. I have had diarrhea, flu-like symptoms, trouble breathing, cough, tiredness, weakness, severe headaches. I actually feel worse than I did before I started taking the medication. The side effects are not worth the bebefit.

column2: KWIRTZ, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
roar119, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Swallowing a pill a day is the easiest form of treatment in my opinion however if it makes you sick(er) it certainly isn't worth the ease of use! I ended up with more symptoms and pains AFTER starting the meds. My fever went up to a 101 degrees every day causing chills, tremors and headaches. A UTI ensued and I went to bed within approximately 1 hour after taking this medicine since I felt so awful. All of this happened after a few short days of taking this medicine. I had already taken methotrexate with folic acid after taking other meds for pain and prednisone for inflamation. My next step is to try Remicade according to my rheumatologist. I hope that proves to be a better medicine for me!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got terrible crippling headaches after three days of taking it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication caused severe hair loss for me. I noticed lots of hair in the shower and when I ran my fingers through my hair it was coming out in my hand. I stopped use and within a year my hair was nearly back to normal.

column2: GLORIA, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was finally diagnosed about a year ago and was put on Plaquinil...developed clots in my bladder so I had to stop it.  Then was on methotrexate for several months and it was really helping me, but developed a fungal pneumonia.  Have been on the leflunomide for about 3 1/2 months. I started out on 1/2 a pill every other day and then increased to 1 pill daily when I wasn't showing any side effects.  I have been on folic acid from the very beginning of my treatment regimen.  I absolutely love my rheumatologist...she is right on top of everything and I feel blessed to have found her !!

column2: skippy, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Arava for almost 15 years and it is the only med that I have not had a severe reaction too.  I do have COPD and unsure if the med is part of the cause.

column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Experienced sewvere itching throughout my body

column2: margaretb, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have developed a sore mouth, my lips burn and my tongue feels like it has cuts on it. I have to be careful what I eat,or my mouth gets really painful.

column2: mahst1231@bellsouth.net, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: makes me extreamly sleepy can not function if taken during the day.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: only benn taking this drug for 1 month

column2: ICKYM, 65-74 Male  (Patient)
column9: I SWITCHED TO LEFLUNOMIDE AFTER ALMOST DYING WHILE TAKING METHOTREXATE - MY IMMUNE SYSTEM WAS LOWERED AND I CONTRACTED FUNGAL PNEUMONIA (VALLEY FEVER).  SO BOTTOM lINE FOR MTX, IT IS A DEATH DRUG AS I SEE IT.NOW FOR LEFLUNOMIDE,IT SEEMS IMPOSSIBLE TO GET THROUGH MEDCO, (MY PRESCRIPTION DRUG PROVIDER), BUT THE LITTLE STORE DOWN THE BLOCK HAD IT?  MEDCO TRIED TO SELL ME AVARA (WHICH COSTS $952 DOLLARS FOR 90 DAYS SUPPLY.  LEFLUNOMIDE COST $12 FOR 90 DAYS SUPPLY.  SOMETHING STINKS HERE ON THIS MATTER SO I HAVE ASKED MY SENATORS FROM MICHIGAN TO GET THE FDA TO INVESTIGATE.  NOW, FOR THE EFFECTIVNESS OF LEFLUNOMIDE, MY BODY HURTS AND MY JOINTS ARE STILL SORE, MY EYES ARE BLURRED, AND I DON'T KNOW IF THE LEFLUNOMIDE IS WORKING OR NOT - IT HAS BEEN ABOUT 6 MONTHS.  I GUESS I NEED TO CONTACT A REAL RHEUMATOID DOCTOR AND FIND OUT WAHT WORKS.  I WAS NOT ENCOURAGED BY THESE WRITEUPS AT ALL.  GUESS I WILL KEEP USING GOOD OLD HEAT TO LOOSEN ME UP.  I have concluded that this is an illness that needs lots more investigation.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Dori, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I take 10 mg daily and it takes the swelling down the majority of the time. 20 mg per day made me somewhat sick but maybe I needed to build up to that. There is time for that I guess. It matters what brand you take Sandoz (sp?) for me. It did take a 4 months to reach potential.

column2: Flora, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was switched from Methotraxate to Leflunomide because my methotraxate could no longer be increased due to my high kidney levels.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I developed nodules with methatrexate so doc put me on the Leflunomide.  I had a rash in the beginning, but doc changed dose to every other day and it went away.  In combination with Remicade infusions every 8 weeks it has made a big difference in my pain I have had stomach problems and some hair loss, but worth the benefits if caused by the leflunomide.

column2: nanaby58, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for my ra for 4 years, i have had a problem that no dr can diagnose. called in vulvadinya? i ran out of meds and the symptoms are going away, I wonder if it is because of the drug? need a new drug!

column2: Annie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took it for 18 days in addition to MTX, enbrel, celebrex. I developed stabbing pain in the rheumatoid nodules on the soles of my feet and the nodules seemed puffier and larger than before. I stopped taking the drug.

column2: sansu, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: have been on it for years and had good success, however for the last year I have been to the Doctor or ER 8 times with nauseau, vomiting, urinary tract infection, weekness and the last 3 months constantly sick. my Dr finally decided it may be the Leflunomide causing all my symptoms. I have to go for atest today to run a tube down my esophagus and check my stomach and then he wants me to see my Rheumatologist and see what to do from there. After reading all the problems caused by Leflunomide I really think thats my problem. Should fond out something within the next 1 days. I just want to feel better again.Maybe I will be able to use humira only without all the problems. I will check the sideeffects out more closely this time.

column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: it seem to help

column2: Joyce, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have found this medication useless.  After being taken off methotrexate because of lung problems we (doctor/myself) tried this; so far nothing.  Joints hurt worse.  Anyone know how long it takes to start working?  Been on it 1 month.

column2: Will, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: RA for 20 years, on meds for 16.  Prednisone works great, MTX made me nauseous after about 10 years.  I've been on Arava for 2 years, am having a lot of numbness and tingling, muscle weakness, no appetite and weight loss.  Hair loss too.  Bad infection, almost lost my big toe and still may.  Humira didn't help.  Rheumatologist keeps pushing  Orencia.  I hate my Rheumatologist.   3mg of naltrextone reduced the number of flares and the intensity.  No more visits to the ER in the 18 months that I've been taking it. Gold shots worked but lowered my platelet count and had to quit.

column2: brenda, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: have only been taking a brief while but i have  noticed on all these medicines that you ever have a metallic taste that is because your doctor should have prescibed folic acid, as well.

column2: elln50, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The levels count for RA should be between 1 and 20, mine were 320 when diagnosed, I saw a Rhuematologist in July and started thisill by Nov my counts are 13!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I am not sure  - however it seems that it has helped with no sde effects.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
DeeDee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Don't know if it helped only took 3 weeks and got sores in muoth and lip. Stopped taking it but still have sores 8 days later. Worried about infection. Not worth it.

column2: cma, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken for 2 months now.  Systems are worse than ever.  I now hurt so bad in my feet, knees, hips, and neck.  I do not beleive that this med is going to work.  Side effect is diarrhea and overall feeling of really tired and sore.

column2: Tippysnail, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Prescribed Arava over 6 months ago as due to enlarged liver my gastro said it would be dangerous to take Methotrexate. I have noticed my disease advance - toes in particular almost constantly painful and  more deformed and painful with nodules and diarrhoea from taking it. Knees also more painful and constant. Has not had a positive effect - if anything I feel it has done nothing except given me undesirable side effects.

column2: Ranger Flo, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: have been using this drug along with hydroxychloroquine received a severe rash

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started to loose my hair after 6-8weeks.  Stopped taking the drug and my hair is still falling out.  The drug was only marginally helpful and the side effect is worse that the RA.

column2: gobucs, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this drug 2 months ago.  The effectiveness is marginal at best and my hair began falling out.  I have stopped taking this drug.

column2: cabsqueen, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Take it with 50 mg Enbrel and so far it is making it easier to move and no side effects.  Have tried other drugs with the Enbrel and this is the first one that helps with no side effects.  Right now RA is in remission.

column2: inpainalot , 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: had done nothing for me, i'm worse or as bad as when i started taking 9 month's ago.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I move a lot better now, I don't wake up as stiff as I use too.

column2: cherry, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Using this drug for AS along with Embrel. The swelling is reduced, doesn't stop knee pain.  I seem to have stomach discomfort gas problems. Still need to take Advil.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
DONNA, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have experience a metallic bad taste in my  mouth,metallic odor when I void or have a BM and sweat,pain in my left arm and fatigue.Nausea all the time,can't eat,this is all normal side effect,I don't think I'll take this drug any longer.I've been on a few RA med's in the pass that have these same side effect,I guess I just sick of been sick and taking drug,Please lord help me through this.

column2: Jackrab359, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This drug makes my life a lot better, but my pain has increase. i do move a little better but I am still having prolems in walking, I have arithritis for about 40 years and finaly found a pill to keep my swilling down and that great. I have a wonderful doctor and she never gave up om my problems with arithritis.

column2: leonie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on it for about six years now and find it one of the better medications for rhumitiod.

column2: bob, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: satisfied, dont eat much thou.

column2: suzmar, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Been on it over 2 yrs after a short course of methatrexate (that didn't help at all_. Take it with Plaqunil.  I do blood work evey 2 months to check liver etc.

column2: leflunomide Oral, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: After trying several other medications for RA, found this one to be most effective

column2: teegee119,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking leflunomide for 5 months because of Lupus.  It has helped and reduced the pain by at least 80%.  I have had no side effects. I have my liver checked every month, and hope that I will be able to continue on the leflunomide.

column2: Starr, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using this drug for about 3 months as my doctor told me it takes 30-45 days to become active.  I take this along with prednisone. I wake up every day with pains in my hands and wrists.  Sharp shooting pains run from my shoulder to my fingers. I experienced some hair loss and have developed a rash on my shoulders.  My flare ups still occur and because this is all new to me this is the only second type of medication I have tried after having troubles with mtx.

column2: AC, 65-74 Female  (Patient)
column9: My right arm iches and hurts when I scratch my nose is running  I sweat my right side hurts I was taking Enbrel 50 mgs. per week I have a head ach when I wake up . Most morning  some times the  blood rushes to my head if I stand up to fast and I become dizzy and have to lay down . I seem to be losing my appetite I have been eating a lot of fruit because I don't aseem hungry and I am more forgettful.

column2: nomi258, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: for the first 2 years it worked better than any other drug i had taken for RA, now it is less effective. my hair is falling out, my blood pressure is out of control, i have leg cramps and nausea.

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: My RA was in remission, it's not now since I've been taking leflunomide.

column2: bumba, 45-54 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: had to have surgery for an embilical hernia, 4 days after surgery got a serious infection, taken off of drug for 5 month to heal from surgery and infection, put back onto drug, i dont think its working much as I still have numerous flare ups

column2: labrat, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: not sure its helping much, still have bad flareups occasionaly.

column2: chris31, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am satisfied with the drug but I have dreadly side affect like flue symptoms likeunder the side affects of the drug but because I have a progressive RA i will continue under doctor supervision my history is very complicatied I have 4 other diseases that affect my RA as I have diverse reation to metrorexate

column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: hair fallout

column2: deacon, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on leflunomide since March 2009 and have no jopint pain and no side effects that I can blame on the drug.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a flare-up of my RA. I had to switch medications, and this one really calmed my RA down. I have had to take Prednisone with it for a few months because the medication takes time to kick in. I temporarily experienced hair loss.

column2: Debbie, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I have been on this med for 3 years.  I have experienced very mild to no side effects.  Ocassionally a rapid heart beat and/or pain in the left buttox.  No damage to liver and no damage from the RA to my joints.

column2: Casey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Leflunomide since March and really thought it was working great. About 2 months ago I started experiencing extreme amounts of hair loss. I thought this was suppose to be a rare side effect. I was wrong. I stopped taking it 9 days ago and am thinning out. I know this is a superficial thing to be picky about, but I miss my hair. Be cautious when taking the medicine and report this side effect early to your doctor or you can end up like me.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: No relief on MTX, Humira, Orencia. After about 4 months on Leflunamide, I noticed improvement. No side effects for me, although liver enzymes increased and had to stop temporarily. RA got worse when not on med, then stabilized again when I was able to resume taking it. It's helped me a lot.

column2: aer, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I take this medication for dermatomyocitis, an auto-immune disease. For 4 years, I tried everything available just short of IV meds.  Finally, my doctor tried me on this and it has worked wonderfully.

column2: chubby, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm taking Leflunomide and Orencia, so I'm not sure which drug is causing this problem.  There is a very bad odor when I perspire, urinate or have a bowel movement.  This is only happening since I started taking these drugs a couple of months ago. It is a sickening smell to me, which I can only discribe as cooked meat. This odor may be fine if you're making a dinner. buy not if it is coming out of your body. I'm wondering if my ORGANS are slow-cooking.  This is not a joke!  Has anyone else had this problem?  Help!!!

column2: jacko, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
happy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm on 20 mgs a day . After the second day of use this drug I started having severe stomach.intestinal pain,pain when breathing,chest pain, headaches ,nausea, dizziness,chills, neck and back pain,itchy scalp and face. I've stop taking this drug but still having trouble. It's been two days since I last took it and still I'm having trouble . I personal do recommend it .

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: lost of hair

column2: Molly, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I really hoped that it would work so I have put up with the side effects. The doctor had me stop taking it for a couple days because I developed a rash on my arms,top of my feet and the backs of my knees itched, This morning I woke up with a sore on my tongue and my lips were swollen. I got somewhat better through the day. The rash on my arms has decreased. I haven't taken the medication for 5 days. The doctor wants to start it up again in a smaller dose when all of this allergic reaction calms down. I'm hoping my body gets use to it.

column2: janetbuckleyb@aol.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm taking it for RA.  Switched from MTX to Leflunomide. This is the second script- 2nd month.  I'm going to stop taking it today.  It's causing real bad, bad, low back pain and shooting/tremulous pain in buttocks. I'm also experiencing shooting pain in various parts of my body.  Similar to what I experienced with MTX. I also have a mild rash. Was on MTX for about 2yrs.  It gave me bad crippling pain in lower neck and under and around shoulder blades. MTX also gave me burning, stinging, pulsating feet. Off that too. Throughout my affliction, Celebrex has stayed true to its effectiveness and what it is suppose to do.  I've just been prescribed Humira (Pen). Will start today. I pray this will be my answer to my inflammation, joint pain in legs, toes, heels of my feet and my poor fingers and wrists. And this horrible all-over feeling.  I'm just tired.  I read the opinions of the Humira users and overall, they seem to be satisfied with its effectiveness.  Thanks Web MD for allowing us to share our experiences. It really does help!

column2: Danigirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After 6 weeks my hair started falling out! I stopped taking the medication 2 weeks ago and it is still falling out. No relief - I was going to give it 8 weeks but can't take the hair loss.

column2: dana, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am taking it for psoriatic arthritis. The pain was horrible but after taking leflunomide I am in less pain now.
